text:
It would appear that the description of mod_proxy keepalive should be in seconds instead of milliseconds. 

The documentation says: "...This flag will tell the Operating System to send KEEP_ALIVE  messages on inactive connections (interval depends on global OS settings, generally 120ms), and thus prevent the firewall to drop the connection..."

Yet, for example in linux, the interval is commonly 75 seconds no milliseconds.
creator: smendenh@redhat.com

text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
creator: rbowen@apache.org

text: thanks for the report, clarified in r1031062 and r1031063.
creator: covener@gmail.com

text: Dan Poirier mentioned offline that the original doc probably mean 120 minutes, not milliseconds, which makes sense given what the defaults seem to be.
creator: covener@gmail.com
